reviews.sentence: Too crowded. I was stunned by how many people just mill about the lobby of this hotel. No crowd control. The restaurant is good but the bar lounge is odd it closes really early so you have to go to the restaurant to continue your evening if you are so inclined. should not it be the other way around. And the rooms are tired tired tired. I have stayed 3 times not again unles there is an amazing promotion and each time had to change my room. Not value for money but that is London I suppose. Good location.
Wonderful. Great location very nice refurbished room and very comfy bed. Breakfast was a bit confusing but did not spoil our overall experience.

good location but not value for money. the location was greatrom not cleaned whilst we had been out all day and when we got back late afternoon we had to ask reception to get someone to clean and service the room.

wifi sucks staff not accommodating location though there are a lot more hotels near by which we should have gone forour room was not ready waited for 3 hours and when it was ready the room smelled like someone was smoking it in. it smelled disgusting. wifi sucks it keeps kicking us off. tub and sink clogged staff not accommodating attitude so so.
Expect better facilities working ones for the money. The location. Air con and tv both faulty. Had to call room service 3 times. Fixed the air con but TVs not working both days.
Costly 10 £ daily and inefficient WifiIneficient support at Business Center.

Smells of Damp Dirty Old roms Furniture Processed food YuckThis hotel is living off it s Mayfair area terrible. I came to this hotel as our friends were getting married around the corner. Check in was 2 pm we arrived at 230pm. The room still was nt ready. I was a little worried as i need to get changed and hurry to the wedding. Final they found a room for us. I do nt see why this should of been a problem as check out is at 12. Anyway with the added stress on arrival we final got in to our room to the smell of damp. Not having anytime to switch rooms we had no choice but to hurry up and get ready to go. The next day i had ordered breakfast to our room. The food was terrible not even edible The food was like rubber. Cheap sausages and processed food yuck. £ 22 for a full English and i did nt even eat it. Coffee was ok but still not great. I do nt mind paying the price but i do mind not beginning able to eat it. The shower had no screen on the bath. So the bathroom floor was covered in water. This is probably why it smells of damp in the room. Also it s very dangerous with water all over the floor. On check out we tried to let the receptionist know about the shower screen and the smell of damp but she just ignored what we said. We said it twice. We were nt trying to get money off just help them improve there room. even though looking back now we should nt of paid especially for breakfast. I do nt know why we bothered they did nt care. I did nt even say about breakfast. We paid our bill and left as we could nt be bothered to get into a debate and i know they would of because that s why she was ignoring our complaint about the shower screen. I just wo nt ever go back again and thought i d write on here. Also one more thing our room was dirty. There was also somebody s old tissue on the floor. YUCK. I did nt think i was staying in Mayfair that s for sure. What a terrible hotel.

Nice hotel to stay in. We had a big family booking 4 rooms checking in was not that easy as the hotel were full it did not make sense to me as I had a confirmed booking. The rooms are small in general classic design not my type The location is perfect of u are someone who enjoys woking around The service is good Staff are ok in general The price are a little bit higher then what is expected. Enjoy your stay Ajayan.

Improvements needed. Stayed here for a week out of 3 weeks of my business trip. The location of the hotel is right smack in the middle of Mayfair and a short walk away from the tube station. The facade of the hotel is so well maintained and looks really nice as in the movies. However When you get into the hotel everything was a little dark and dingy. I checked in fairly late and was assigned a room on level 2 and was right at the end of the hotel. This means that I have a big room with a small sofa and king sized bed. The room was again very dimly lit and tired it overlooks the entrance which is rather depressing view. It took me 1 hour to set up my wifi in order to get my work done with help from the vendor. The fixtures in the room are all quite old and the bath tub just does not drain fast enough when you take a shower. Not good. The inside of the hotel needs a lot of work to match the facade.

A very comfortable stay in the heart of London. I was only in the hotel for a 1 night business stay to that end I did not have time to explore. enjoy all the features of the hotel. The room I was offered was excellent. It was on the higher floors overlooking the sqaure. A good size room for london standards although the bathroom was a little too small for my liking. The bed was comfortable the room very clean and most importatantly the room had blackout curtains. Breakfast is very good as expected from a hotel of this standard. Location simply superb. You can walk to Oxford street Bond street within 5 minutes. Picadily Circus is only 10 minutes away. Great location for both business and sightseeing travellers.

Comfortable conveniently located with excellent breakfast Breakfast. excellent choice of hot and cold food. My room was spacious and the bed comfortable. There is an NCP car park at the hotel with good wide oarking slots though the entrance and exit are rather tightThere was a draft from the window. The pillows were rather hard. I would apreciare an extra socket as there was not enough for iPad iPhone and a kettle.
Good spot for lunch.

Pleasant stay. Very slow but friendly check in and same for check out. The lift was not working to go to my room but had been repaired whenever I needed to use it. Water in room juddering from taps assume residual issue from Thames Water problems I stayed in a nearby hotel the week before and there was no water but eventually worked properly. Room reasonable size of decent quality. Scaffolding outside the room and during afternoon a fair bit of noise from builders had not been made aware previously. But stopped early evening. Decent nights sleep. Evening meal and breakfast excellent. Service good. Great location and short walk to Bond Street tube. Given what is dominating the news at the moment was interested to be told that this is the hotel where Alexander Litvinenko drank tea back in 206.

Stay was nice and staff is very kind and friendly. Location location it ’s an old hotel but rooms are clean and comfortable Hotel needs renovation. Bathroom facilities are poor compare of what you can get in different hotels.
Great stay. Really comfy bedsRom available very quickly.

Convenient location in London. Well located hotel. You can take the tube to go around London. To wake up in the morning and go to Hyde Park to do more miles on your running shoes. Go to Oxford street and wondering all the way to Marble Arch. Its rooms are very comfortable and peaceful. Just across of Grosvenor Square and the US Embassy.

Amazing experience. We were skeptical to book this hotel as it only opened a few days before our check in but are so glad we went ahead with it. Even with some of the facilities not open yet it truly exceeded our expectations. The service was excellent and the staff were very friendly. The courtyard suite was spacious and the view over Grosvenor Square was beautiful. The location is amazing and within walking distance of the main streets in London. I will definitely book a stay in The Biltmore again.

Amazing people. Checked in at the last moment and could not have been treated better. Everyone from the doorman to the concierge were amazing. Facilities are terrific. The hotel is beautiful and the people can not help you enough. Thank you.

a weekend break. The. Biltmore Mayfair Hotel well we ware very impressed with the hotel its just wonderful. the staff are great and helpful and the rooms are just what we wanted the Restaurant and bar area are fantastic and the menu is perfect. we are hear to calibrate the New Year in and watch the Fireworks on New Years Eve. this is the first time to see the Fireworks.

Fantastic Hotel Staff. My partner and I have stayed in various hotels all over the world and takes some beating to make our top most memorable list. but this hotel has cracked itRecently refurbished with the smell of ‘ new ’ still hanging in the air the staff are just amazing courteous and wherever you need them. From the moment you enter the ‘ wow ’ factor kicks in the level of design and attention to detail is amazing. The room was also stunning with a great view of Grosvenor Square. Clean fresh with complimentary Penhaligon amenities. Again well designed with a lot of thought giving to lighting. Location is again great close to Bond St Underground Station and a pleasant but decent walk to shopping or a stroll round the royal parks. Great stay and wish this hotel every bit of luck at the start of its new chapter.
